criteria.description: Word counter handles hyphenated words, contractions, and emoji consistently; tests cover edge cases.
criteria.justification: Word counting uses a naive split() without normalization; no handling for hyphenation, contractions, or emoji. No tests present.

criteria.description: Reward tiers clearly differentiate exact count vs off-by-one vs larger misses, with documented values.
criteria.justification: Reward is a continuous linear penalty (1 - error/target) with exact match = 1; no distinct tiers or documented tier values.

criteria.description: Theme adherence check (keyword match or embedding similarity) influences reward or metadata.
criteria.justification: No theme adherence check implemented; reward and metadata do not reflect theme matching.

criteria.description: Environment logs word_count, count_difference, and theme_match for every rollout.
criteria.justification: Only logs word_count_error; does not log raw word_count, count_difference, or any theme_match metric.

criteria.description: Output sanitizer enforces plain text (no markup) and strips leading/trailing whitespace before scoring.
criteria.justification: Leading/trailing whitespace is stripped before scoring, but no enforcement of plain text or markup removal.

notes: Additional observations: rollout references get_prompt incorrectly (len(get_prompt) vs len(PROMPTS)), which will raise at runtime. Consider adding a robust tokenizer/word counter, explicit reward tiers (e.g., exact=1.0, off-by-one=0.8, small miss=0.5, large miss=0), a theme keyword/embedding match that influences reward/metadata, and metrics logging for word_count, count_difference, and theme_match.
